dialogues.text: Shooting tourists in the Athens airport. Blowing up pharmacies in Amsterdam. And that Mossad agent in Barcelona before that. Europe hasn’t been this interesting since Napoleon marched to Moscow! Louis starts to count the money again.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Do you have to do that?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Salameh is in London. For the usual price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans is bent over a desk, working fastidiously with razor glue, a small iron, colored inks and stamps he retrieves an open salesman’s sample case, altering passports and vi Robert sits near him, watching him work with interest. Ca and Steve are sitting. Avner is cleaning, checking and loading guns, a gun cleaning kit at hand, silent and remo from the others, brooding. Everyone’s frayed, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We followed him today from his doctor to his hotel.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: He’s here for eye treatments.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Salameh. You saw him? You followed him!?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Salameh?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Wearing sunglasses in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you shoot him?!

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: He had bodyguards. Civilians.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Were they armed? Then they’re not civilians. I'd have done it! If you'd ever give me have a chance to to actually shoot someone, I'm the only one who actually wants to shoot these guys!

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: You can take my place the next time out.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s why we never let you do it. Your enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping above:) Only our target gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, why start worrying now?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Doe you have any idea how many laws we've broken?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Well, I forge the documents that get you in and over and across and around those laws so I have some idea, yes.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Do you know how many treaties we've violated?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: And still I manage to get a night’s sleep, every night. It’s time to stop your hand-wringing, it’s counter-productive.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you make a list of every single law, Carl, or, or...

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (overlapping above:) Including, incidentally, the laws of the State of Israel, which has no death penalty.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: E’11 tell you what your problem is, habibi: These guys we're killing are dressed in expensive suits, this is London and not some ugly Arab village, and that disorients you.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I'm not disoriented, I'm keeping my sanity by occasionally reminding myself that in spite of the work I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I‘m going to vote that we adjourn our little minyan for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (Overlapping above:) But it’s the same old war we're fighting, over the same old scrap of desert.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (overlapping above: ) -- remembering I’m still at least in principle a human being -~

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Remembering that you're human is one thing, broadcasting it so relentlessly is something else.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: {to Avner:) Are you going to call a hait to this? I’d recommend it.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (overlapping above: ) A thing which I've noticed some people surrender all too willingly.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: Let's find a pub. Who besides me needs a drink?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We’ve brought our war to Kensington and, and Copenhagen and it’s not like these European anti-Semites don’t deserve that! Until we learn to act like them we'll never defeat them.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We act like them, all the time. You think they invented bloodshed? How do you think we got control of the land? By being nice?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: I think we have a double-agent in our midst. Pull down his pants, see if he's circumcised.  116. Carl suddenly goes for Steve. They knock into Hans’s tabl upsetting and ruining his work, spilling ink. Hans yells scrambles on all fours to rescue his documents while Avne and Robert get in between Steve and Carl, who keep strugg to get at one another.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER ROBERT
dialogues.text: Stop it! Goddamn it, stop Please, please, calm down, it! Both of you! calm down. Everyone's just... Just tired and --

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: {over the above, to himself:) Nonsense, nonsense, infantile undisciplined distraction and nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Two million dollars. At least. Mrs. Meir says to the Knesset that the world must see that killing Jews will be from now on an expensive proposition. But killing e Palestinians isn’t exactly cheap. Avner returns to his place, sits, starts to eat again and stops. No one is eating. Hans pours another drink.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: (to Avner:) If all eleven were dead, you'd stop?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: You're lying. What about their replacements? What if each time we Kill we create six more?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Then maybe I would have to keep killing them.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Forever? Hans finishes off his glass and pours another, Avner star @ te eat again.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Five targets are still alive. Five more men to kill. Eventually, I suppose, you forget you were once someone who really hated doing it. Or who cares? What I feel, personally, gets less, every day. Someday, I'll get up in the morning, kill... go to bed at night. And I won't feel anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Huh. Hans finishes off the glass and pours another drink. Stev reaches out to stop him, Hans pulis away.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: There‘s enough here to feed Bangladesh. Stop drinking and eat something. HANS . I keep seeing the Dutch woman, you know, sprawled out like that. It’s not that I wish we hadn't killed her, But... {to Avner:) I wish I'd let you close up her housecoat.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Well, you weren't yourself. Avner eats. Hans drinks.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Steve is knocking softly but insistently on Avner's door. Avner opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I went to Hans's flat, over the, um, antique shop, just to check up, he was so... Anyway, he’s gone somewhere. I waited. All night. He hasn't come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitter cold, and glittering: Some of the moisture from th night before has crystallized into hoarfrost. Hans is sit on a bench, facing the pond. He’s icy, dead. His hands ar limp at his side, eyes open. His face under the frozen ra and condensation is completely grey. Avner, shivering in the cold, sits next to Hans's body, leoking around. He unbuttons Hans’s shirt, moves the froz fabric aside. It crackles. There's a dark narrow oblong wound in his chest above his heart, frozen blood crusted around it.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Knife. Steve is standing nearby, gun drawn. The park’s deserted.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He walked here every night, he... Avner searches Hans's pockets, retrieving a wallet, an Austrian passport, a gun.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They didn't take anything.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Who walks in a park at night? Maybe he was a homo. I don‘t know anything about him. Steve sits on the other side of Hans.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Louis will send someone.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He's selling us, he ~-

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: He walked here every night. Anyone could -- teve's fighting hard not te lose control. Avner closes Hans‘s coat. Then his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: This is ... awful. I'm... I’m going to check on, um, tell Robert. He should know, we have to be careful, we...

dialogues.speaker: 210L
dialogues.text: STEVE (cont'd) It‘s awful. Avner? Avner startles out of some reverie.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: What? I... I was... I wasn’t Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner is alone in the safe house. He turns out the lights He walks to his bedroom. He‘’s about to open the door to bedroom, when he freezes, thinking he’s heard a noise ins He puts his ear to the door, listens. He goes back to the front room and gets his gun from his holster. INT. AVNER’S BEDROOM, FRANKFURT SAFE HOUSE - NIGHT 2107 He throws opens the door to his bedroom, gun at the ready The room is empty. He goes to the door of the closet. Gun ready, he opens th closet door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage stands alone in a field. It’s very dark outsi no other houses around. A few longhair sheep are rooting around for edible grasses. There’‘s light in the cottage windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage is a weird combination of explosives workshop toy repair shop, bomb parts and disassembled toys intermingled; on one table is a huge, elaborate war game, beautifully articulated toy soldiers with working parts facing each other across a splendid, painted battlefield. Robert is alone, coat hanging from a peg on the wall. He looks exhausted and sad. He's wearing plastic protective goggles. He's packing up the place, putting explosives, machinery in crates for detonation outdoors in the mornin He looks at his hands; they're trembling. He tries to war them, rubbing them together. They're still trembling. He removes his protective goggles and rubs his eyes.  139. He takes tools from a wall cabinet, then stops: he finds pouch of very old velvet. He removes it, opens it, and ta out a tallis and tefillin. He stares at these for a momen He sits. ‘Then slowly, tightly he binds the tefillin arou his left arm and his forehead. He covers his head with th tallis and begins to daven, reciting the Hebrew prayer fo travellers.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (IN HEBREW)
dialogues.text: May it be thy will, Oh Lord our God and God of our fathers, to conduct us in peace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner is holding the closet door open. No one is inside. He sits on the bed, hyperflexing his left hand, holding h gun in his right, not able to calm down, no idea what to with himself. He stands, slides a chair under the doorknob. He paces the floor of the bedroom. He hangs his gun, in its holster, near the bed. He carefu lifts the mattress to see if there's a bomb under it. Of course there isn't. He takes a pocket knife out of his pocket, opens it, lifts the mattress again and slits it o then searches the innards, looking for a bomb. Again, nothing. Robert's prayer is heard over the scene:

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (VO IN HEBREW)
dialogues.text: ++. to direct our steps in peace, to uphold us in peace, and to lead us in life, joy and peace unto the haven of our desire. Oh deliver us from every enemy, ambush and injury by the way, and from all afflictions that visit and trouble the world. Send a blessing upon the work of cur hands. Let us obtain grace, lovingkindness, and mercy in Thine eyes and in the eyes of all who behold us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert finishes the prayer.  2100

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (IN HEBREW)
dialogues.text: Hear the voice of our supplications. For Thou art a God who hears prayers and supplications. Blessed art Thou, Oh Lord, who hears all prayers. Robert folds up the tallis, takes off the tefillin, puts away. INT. AVNER‘'S BEDROOM, FRANKFURT SAFE HOUSE - NIGHT 2100 Avner is undressing. He sits on the bed. He reaches for the phone. Then he sto himself. He fishes for a swiss army knife and opens the screwdriver. With extreme care he lifts the phone, turns over, and delicately unscrews the bottom plate. It's a normal phone. Without putting the plate back on, he dials

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I want to place a collect call to Brooklyn New York, the number is 21262... : oy Lets gus He stops, then hangs up the phone. He pulls the guts out the phone, looking for something, a bug or a bomb. He gets his gun from the holster and climbs into bed. He switches off the light. He lies still, staring into darkness. He listens to his o breathing: shallow, panicked. He gets out of bed, checks door, the chair propped under the knob. He listens throug the door, his panic is building. He looks at the bed but doesn’t go towards it. He looks at the closet, the door ajar. A moment's hesitation, then he steps inside the clo and closes the door almost completely, leaving a crack fo air and sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner curls up on the floor of the closet, leaning agains ironing board, cradling the gun. He tries to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert has resumed packing. He picks up a toy ferris whee and winds it, sets it down and watches it spin around and around. He turns back to the wires and bottles and bricks plastic explosives. He picks up a timer.
The ferris wheel slows down, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous explosion blows the cottage apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner's asleep. The phone in the bedroom is ringing. He wakes up with a jolt, not knowing where he is. He tries t stand and rams his head on the clothes pole above him. Hangers rain down and the ironing board falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner stumbles out of the closet, freeing himself from th debris. He lunges for the phone. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: What? OMITTED ‘ 2100

dialogues.speaker: STORE ON A FANCY STREET IN PARIS
dialogues.text: Avner is standing in front of the display, which has been changed -- a new but still beautiful modern kitchen. Behi him, reflected in the glass, he sees Robert, walking towa him, smiling gently. They make eye contact through the reflection. Robert seems to be standing right behind Avne He's asking Avner something, either moving his lips or it just a question in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: It will be beautiful. Eventually. Avner places his hand over Robert's face. Then he turns. Louis is standing there. Avner stares at Louis, hard. Louis takes a handkerchief o of his pocket, then reaches past Avner to wipe away the handprint that Avner’s left on the plate glass window.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Ali Hassan Salameh is in Tarifa, on the Spanish coast. He’s in a compound guarded by all the predictable trouble.  142. Avner doesn’t respond, staring a Louis as if not seeing h

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Bomb makers often die accidental deaths. (shrugs) In Athens, you shot a KGB agent. Many people must want to kill you, Monsieur Storsch. But why would I do that? You pay better than anyone. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s dangerous, going after Salameh. But he planned the Munich massacre. Eliminate him and they'll let you go home. Don’t you think? They look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Yes, Louis. I do. They smile at one another, not friendly, but, Avner havin acknowledged his affiliation, both know that this is the of their business together.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: You could have a kitchen like this someday. It costs dearly. Home always does.

dialogues.speaker: SPAIN
dialogues.text: Avner and Steve, in black clothing, faces grimed for camouflage, are crawling through the trimmed grass of a l in the deep shadow of a garden wall, towards a great hous several of the windows of which are lit. Slung across the backs, Steve and Avner carry high-powered rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house in nearer. Egyptian music can be heard. still lying flat in the grass, Steve's looking through ni vision binoculars at large glass doors through which a va library can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Shit. It's like a fucking fun house. He hands the binoculars to Avner, lying beside him. Avner looks. Avner stops, looks through the binoculars at the large gl doors of the room next to the library.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The panels of glass in the exterior doors of the room are clear, smoke and amber, thick, wavy, bevelled. The room within is panelled with mixrors set at odd angles, and mirrored doors that swing open and close, catching and lo reflections. A row of big crystal chandeliers down the le of the room add myriad prismatic lights to the confusion. A number of Arab men, perhaps as many as twenty, are movi large wooden boxes around. They're rendered cubist fragme by the distortions of the glass, the lights and the mirro cUT BACK TQ34A Avner and Steve in the dark outside.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Can you tell how many?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Avner's moving the bineculars methodically back and forth scanning the faces in the library. Suddenly he sees someo only for an instant, whe might be Salameh. Then he’s gone

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TOS4A
dialogues.text: Steve and Avner.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: That’s him. He’s in there.  235 236 144.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Avner focuses the binoculars on the library again. He immediately zooms in on the back of the head of a man, standing near a series of mirrored doors. The man turns. It's definitely Salameh. He's talking to someone, smoking cigarette. Avner's focusing the glasses, bringing Salameh nearer. Th sounds of the night intensify, the music, Arabic conversa from the house, crickets, the distant surf and Avner’s ow breathing. Salameh suddenly stops talking, takes a deep drag on his cigarette -- and then he seems to look straight out the french doors of the library, out through their panes of distorting colored glass, out into the dark, as if seekin out and then locking directly with Avner’s gaze. One of the mirrored doors behind Salameh opens, then anot then another, and all at once the face in the binoculars repeated, over and over, full face, profile, rear view, staring hard at something -- it seems to be Avner -- with strange expression: familiarity, hatred, taunting.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Too many Men. We’re gonna get killed. They hear a sound of someone walking on gravel coming fro the garden behind them. They go completely flat and roll deeper into the shadows. Avner leaves the binoculars on t grass. They unsling their rifles and release the safeties A man is standing with his back to them, taking 4 leak. H has a kalashnikov slung across his back. Avner sees the binoculars in the verge of the terrace. He taps Steve, and points. Steve mouths a silent "shit" then starts to inch towards binoculars. The peeing man is finished, he’s zipping up h fly. Steve's elbow snaps something dry in the grass. The man wheels around. It's a teenage boy, fourteen or fifteen years old. The boy sees Avner and Steve. He start to fumble for his kalashnikov. Steve is already on his fe taking aim, Avner close behind him.  250 145. Steve fires, then Avner, one bullet knocking the kid off feet, the other hitting him in the eye, making his head explode. His body topples back into the bushes. Avner and Steve hear shouts coming from inside the house. Someone in the dining room flings the door opens and call out something in Arabic. They crouch, edging back into th shadows. Suddenly there's a burst of machine-gun fire, sending stone and gravel and dirt flying. Steve starts to run back towards the shore. Avner catches his arm, spins him around and drags him in the opposite direction. Avner runs in this direction, and Steve follow As they approach the main gates Avner trips, stumbles, cutting his face. He sits there, stunned. Steve hauls him his feet and they resume their run to the gate. Avner fires at the center of the locked gate while Steve turns and fires several rounds into the blackness behind them.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Both men run at the two halves and crash into them. The gates burst open, and Avner and Steve run pell-mell down drive. Noises of pursuit, running, shouting, from within compound grow closer. There's a burst of gunfire nearby. Avner and Steve run down the road at top speed. No one is pursuing. They keep running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner runs, as we'd seen him at the start of the sequence face blacked, bloody cut, sweat, terror. He plunges into grass field. He runs through the grass. He throws his rifle away into the grass and runs. His speed accelerates. He runs till the world falls away. is no longer clear where he is. The camera closes in on Avner’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are descending from an El Al plane. Avner is among them. A military jeep, no roof, is waiting. Two you soldiers are sitting on the hood. Avner approaches, looki like he expects to be arrested.  251

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I'm --

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: We know. You want to ride with us?

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hop in. As they get in the jeep, the two soldier in front, Avner back, one of the soldiers turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I'm Yehuda, this is Avi. Shin Beit. We're not supposed to know who you are, because we're not officers, we're just shit and no one tell us shit, but we've heard about what you've done, and we want to say it's an honor to meet you. Yehuda turns back and starts the jeep. Avner, though he's not showing much, is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same room in which Avner first signed for the mission Nothing has changed. Avner is seated, thinking, waiting. A man in civilian clothes walks in, carrying a large tape recorder, microphone, and loops of cable. He smiles at Av puts the equipment on the desk, and starts assembling it, whistling through his teeth. Avner watches this. When the man is done he leaves with a friendly nod te Avner. Ephraim comes in.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: I have no problems with anything you guys did except the woman on the houseboat in Hoorn.  147. Avner is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Steve's told us about her.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: We took leaves of absence and Killed her off the company clock.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot. Otherwise as I said we have no problems with the job you did.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Except three of my men died. Ephraim nods.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Aecording to your colleague, I should say emphatically according to your colleague, not in any way your fault. He sings your praises. -Best. guy he ever worked for :and so . on.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Huh. Steve's not bad either.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: He says this French group ~~ Louis? Was his name? -- they sold the terrorists information regarding your whereabouts. They helped kill your men.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Tell us who they are.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: They won't work with you. JT can't. It's about loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: You're an Israeli officer. That's your only loyalty. That's it. Avner doesn't respond.  148.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK, so -- The door opens. General Yitzhak Hofi enters, two aides behind him. Avner stands, one of the aides closes the doo

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is General Hofi of the Northern Command.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOFI
dialogues.text: Listen, the Prime Minister is proud of you and your men. She wishes she could tell you herself, but she can’t. She never heard of you, right? Avner nods.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOFI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. She says you've done a great thing for your people. For Israel. Hofi embraces Avner, kissing both cheeks. ‘Then he turns go. He stops at the door and looks back at Avner.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL HOFI
dialogues.text: That’s it. There’s no medal or anything. He laughs pleasantly, then leaves. Ephraim sits down at the tape recorder. He turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: (into the mic:) Testing, testing... He rewinds, pushes play. Listens to himself saying "testi testing." Then he switches the machine back to record.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: June 16, 1973. Avner Kauffman. Interview. (to Avner:) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Tell me what you learned.  253

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: What I learned?

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Yes. What did you learn? Avner stares ahead, not at Ephraim. A weight descends on him, sadness, remembering. Ephraim watches, impatient.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Oh for godsake. Tell me the names and numbers of your sources. Avner looks down, not answering.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: I can have you court-martialed. And I might. Avner shakes his head “no.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: You can’t. I don't work for you. (meaning it:) I don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 253
dialogues.text: INT. AVNER’S MOTHER‘S APARTMENT, TEL AVIV - DAY 253K She lives alone. It’s a small, very modest apartment. She serving Avner tea. He looks terrible. Avner looks at the only two pictures on the wall: a photo his father, and a photo of Avner. Both men are in uniform

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: You're divorced. Why do you keep his picture on the wall?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous. Did you visit him? Axyner looks away.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: You look terrible. Avner won't look at her.  150.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER,
dialogues.text: I’m... I’m not good right now, and I don‘t want to see him. She nods her head. They sit, She looks AVNER’S MOTHER I don’t need you to tell me anything. It's taken a lot from you.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I‘m alive. Right? The rest of it... sorts itself out. AVNER‘'S MOTHER I'm not a fool, Avner.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I never said you were a -- AVNER’S MOTHER Some bonds you can't break. Ever. You are who you belong to. not looking at one another.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Everyone in Europe died. Most of my family. (a gesture as if something vanished in the air) Pffit! I never talked to you about it.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I knew. AVNER’S MOTHER You knew. So what was there to say? I didn't die because I came here. When I arrived, I walked to the top of a hill in Jerusalem and I prayed for a child. I never prayed before, but I prayed then. And I could feel all of them were praying with me. at him sadly, with ferocious love. AVNER’S MOTHER You're what we prayed for. What you did, you did for us. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eo” 51. AVNER'S MOTHER (cont'd) For your daughter but also for us. Every one of the ones who died -- died wanting this. (she gestures to the space around her.) What we've had to take because no one will ever give us. A place to be a Jew among Jews. Subject to no one. I thank God for hearing my prayer. Avner looks at her, finally.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Do you want me to tell you, mama? Do you want to know what I did? They look at each other for a beat. AVNER’S MOTHER What‘s there to say? Whatever it took, whatever it takes. A place on earth. We have a place on earth. At last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ephraim is dropping Avner off. Ephraim looks angry. Avner takes a small white cardboard box from his knapsack holds it out to Ephraim. Ephraim doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Baklava. Ephraim takes the box, examines the bakery's sticker affi to the top.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: (with disdain: } From Rehovot? The only edible baklava is from the Arabs in Jaffa. He hands it back to Avner.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eat it on the plane. You're too thin. (angry) I hope it gives you bellyache. Listen, forget it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go see your wife, your child, rest for a few more months. We're going to put you back in the field. Avner doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not Europe. Probably Latin America.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: You'll think it over.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Iwon't. No.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: OK, then you'll come back and -- Avner picks up his suitcase, heads for the plane. Ephraim watches him go. As Avner enters the airport, he runs into a large crowd o Palestinian children, 30 or more kids, boys and girls ran in age from ten to thirteen, pouring out of the airport. kids are all in colored t-shirts that say, in Arabic scri “Kashefat Madressat Yaffa" with the same script and the Arabic letter “aleph” on armband on the left sleeve -- they’re in a kind of summer camp program ,returning from field trip visit to the airport. They surround Avner as t exit, momentarily slowing his progress inside. The kids a chaperoned by three young women, their teachers, two in modern dress, one in a head scarf and traditional dress. Everyone’s talking loudly, talking loudly and excitedly i Arabic. Avner turns briefly to look at the kids. Ephraim has gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chilly very early spring. Daphna is on the stoop, chattin with an old Italian lady who's leaning out of her first s window; Geula is sitting on Daphna’s lap, chewing on @ stuffed animal. Avner‘s standing there, on the sidewalk, carrying a suitc leoking at her. The cut in his cheek is still vivid. He‘s disheveled, he looks lost, deadly exhausted. Daphna sees him, stands up, completely shocked. She sways little. He’s frozen, shy, uncertain, suddenly frightened be here. Geula starts crying, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphna comes out of the bedroom, looking for Avner. She g into the living room. He's sitting on the window seat, looking out at the street, up and down, vigilant. Charlie sits nearby. Daphna sees that Avner's jammed a chair under the doorkno He turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNA
dialogues.text: Nightmares?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. (shakes his head, confused, laughs a little: ) I have no idea where I should be. (He looks around the room: ) It's a nice place. You've made it... nice.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNA
dialogues.text: Come back to bed,  259 249 260 261 262 263 She goes back to the bedroom. She hasn't seen that Avner holding his gun. He watches her go in, then he turns back his vigil. His left hand is clenching, hyperflexing.

dialogues.speaker: LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: It's full summer, blast furnace heat, kids playing in ope hydrants, very green, very humid. Avner is walking to his house. He looks heavier, healthie His face in repose is still very, very sad, but years hav lifted off it. He's dressed in paint-spattered, plaster- Spattered work clothes, coming off a job in small construction. He passes a car in a row of cars parked on the street. Someone's in the car but he doesn't notice it. When he's gone several feet past the car, however, something bother him and he looks back. There's a man inside who might be looking back at Avner. The car pulls out and drives off d Clinton street. There's no license plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner is at a payphone, dressed in his dusty construction clothes.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Sylvie? I want to talk to your father. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: is Louis there?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I want to talk to your father. He reads from the phone dial.
I'll wait. He must call. I'll wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost an hour later. Avner is waiting. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Am I being hunted? Is my family being hunted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa is pitting prunes, phone propped against a shoulder, alone.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: How is your father? He's well? Your family is well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner is silent.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I don't know. How's my family? Are they well? Are they going to be OK?

dialogues.speaker: PAPA
dialogues.text: I'm sending you a parcel of sausage and cheese. Real cheese, the kind you can’t get in America -- it isn't “pasteurized,” so it doesn’t taste like shit. it's a pleasure to hear your voice again. I think about you, with concern. Do you believe me?  268 269 270 156.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner is silent, he doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Avner? You believe me, Avner? Avner is startled.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: You know my name.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: of course I do. Listen to me, it’s important. No harm will come to you from me. Avner. I will never lie to you. Papa hangs up. Avner puts the receiver back in place. He leaves the phon booth. Slowly he shakes his head, “no,” reaching a hard decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot. Avner, still dressed in his constructi clothes, enters the consulate.

dialogues.speaker: MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: The deputy consul, a young Israeli, is sitting behind his desk. Avner enters abruptly without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: If you're Mossad, you know who I am. If you don't, tell Ephraim that Avner came to see you. The deputy consul rises. A secretary tries to come in the office. Avner shoves her out, slams the door and wheels o the frightened deputy consul who sits down again.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Tell Ephraim I won't hesitate to kill other people's children if my child is hurt. or wives if you hurt my wife. Or fathers if you hurt my father. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: 239AA
dialogues.text: 240 157. AVNER (cont'd) Word for word, tell Ephraim. I'll give everything to the newspapers. Who was at every meeting. Every bloody name. If anyone bothers us again. The door behind Avner is forced open by armed embassy gua They grab Avner, who doesn't resist. INT. AVNER AND DAPHNA‘’S BEDROOM, BROOKLYN ~- LATE NIGHT Daphne is asleep. Avner comes in. He gets into bed. He lies there, staring into the dark. He‘s crying silently. Daphna wakes up, looks at him; she reaches over to him, touches his face; he turns away from her. She moves over him, holding him. She kisses him tenderly, consoling. The kiss is returned, becomes sexual. They start to make love gently, uncertainly, then building in intensity and passi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused fragment of helicopter blades, tail-lights, a burst of noise. INT. AVNER AND DAPHNA’S BEDROOM, BROOKLYN - NIGHT 239AA Avner stops making love to his wife. She draws him back i it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopters are landing on the tarmac of the airport. 727 jet stands ready, ostensibly to take the fedayeen and their hostages to Cairo. Apart from a few spotlights, the airport and the runway are dark. The helicopters land. The door of one of the helicopters HAQU) opens, and Issa, Samir, Kader and Salah emerge, rif ready, crouching. Tony and Abu-Halah emerge from the second helicopter (D- HAQO). Issa and Tony move with great caution, away from t helicopter and towards the jet. Tony and Issa approach the jet. They stop, frozen for a moment. They can see that the plane is dark and there's n one in the pilot’s cabin. They suspect a trick. Issa and Tony turn back toward the helicopter. They begin to shout their comrades back at the helicopters.  241 242 243 244 Flood lights atop the building and all around the field b on, lighting up the runway. Then from the runway’s periphery, hidden snipers start firing. Abu-Halah and Salah are gunned down immediately. Paulo, Badran and Samir return fire. Bullets are being fi in all directions. Sniper fire hits Tony in the leg. Ther shouting and screaming. Issa runs hiding behind a helicop (D-HAQO) .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avner and Daphne continue to make love, but something changes. Avner grows silent, strangely concentrated -- he trying to block out images inside his head. His lovemakin becomes rough, angry. He starts fucking her, furiously. Daphna is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the firefight, armored cars are slowly making thei way towards the helicopters on the runway. Behind the armored cars are many soldiers and policemen. The fedayee and the snipers are still firing. Soldiers begin firing a well. Issa climbs into helicopter (D-HAQQ) and sprays machine g fire into Friedman, Halfin and Springer, killing them and injuring Berger in the leg. Issa then leaps from the helicopter, pulls the pin of a grenade and throws it insi It explodes. Kader is spraying the other helicopter (D-HAQU) with mach gun fire. INT. AVNER AND DAPHNA‘S BEDROOM, BROOKLYN - LATE NIGHT 24 Avner is still on top of Daphna, fucking her. His eyes ar screwed shut, he’s growling, his face is contorted with h he’s trying to hurt her. She‘s crying and scared but not stopping him. The baby, in a crib nearby, starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: AIRFIELD
dialogues.text: The helicopter is bursting into flames. The captive men inside are engulfed in flame.  245 246 247 248 271 272

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TOKOL AIRFIELD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kader’s machine gun spray is ripping the cabin apart, striking the bodies of the helplass athletes (cuttfreund, Schorr, Slavin, Spitzer and Shapira), ripping them apart carnage. WIDE SHOT OF AFTERMATH: The two helicopters in flames, th dark plane, bodies on the ground, smoke hanging over everything, men emerging from the shadows on the peripher into the floodlit devastation, the sirens flashing but everything completely silent.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 246
dialogues.text: INT. AVNER AND DAPHNA’S BEDROOM, BROOKLYN - LATE NIGHT 24 Daphna pushes Avner off her, violently. They both lie, panting, terrified. He sits up, facing away from her. He reaches back to touc her. She flinches away, holding herself. EXT. THE BACKYARD OF DAPHNA’S AND AVNER‘S APARTMENT BUILD

dialogues.speaker: BROOKLYN
dialogues.text: It's summer now, the weed growth is rampant. Avner is pil a wheelbarrow with all sorts of junk, waving Charlie away He's still thin, still exhausted, frowning. The cut on hi cheek is now healed. Daphna calls from their rear window:

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Phone for you! He's Israeli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ephraim and Avner are walking past an overgrown park on t Brooklyn waterfront. There‘s an abandoned jungle gym at o end of the park.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: You think we’d hurt your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think anyone is capable of anything.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: I think you're losing your mind.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Did I commit murder? They stop walking. Ephraim looks out over the East River.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I want you to give me proof that every man we killed had a hand in Munich.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: I don’t discuss such things with people who don‘t exist. You want to discuss, come back to existence. You want your daughter to grow up in exile?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I want evidence.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Professor Hamshari with the beautiful wife and child? He was implicated in a failed assassination attempt on Ben Gurion, he was recruiting for Fatah France, enlisting sympathetic non- Arab fanatics eager to destroy the international Zionist conspiracy. You stopped him.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: We should have tried to bring him to Israel.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: And Zwaiter, your harmless little writer in Rome? He was behind the bomb on El Al flight 76 in 1968, he worked on another bomb last August. I can go with this,

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: According to evidence no one has seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVNER (cont'd) If they committed crimes we should have arrested them, like Eichmann.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Tf these guys live, Israelis die. Whatever doubts you have, Avner, you know this is true. We are telling them: if you kill us you will never be safe. We'll find you. (beat) You did well, but you’re unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I killed seven men.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Not Salameh.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: We'll get him, of course. You think you were the only team? It’s a big operation. You were only a part. Does that assuage your guilt?

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: I don’t even know anymore what I want from you. Did we accomplish anything at all? Every man we killed has been replaced by worse.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Why cut my fingernails they'll grow back.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Did we kill them to destroy the terrorist leadership or the Palestinian leadership? Tell me what we've done.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: You killed them for the sake of a country you now choose to abandon. The country your mother and father built. That you were born into. You killed them for Munich, For the future. For peace. If you killed them. If I know you. If we have met before, which we have not. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPHRAIM (cont'd) If you signed a paper, which you have, saying you have no connection with us, with Israel, or any connection with anyone anywhere, anywhere on earth, Avner Kauffman, and you have no context. No wonder you‘re unhappy. I'm unhappy just looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: There's no peace at the end of this. Whatever you believe, you know that‘s true.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: Here‘s what I know: your father’s sick. Your mother will be alone. You're a sabra, your wife and daughter are sabras. What I came to say is this. Come home. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: . AVNER
dialogues.text: No. Ephraim looks down, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Come to my house for dinner tonight. A beat. Ephraim doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: AVNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. You're a Jew. You're a stranger. It's written someplace or other, I’m supposed to ask you to break bread. Break bread with me Ephraim. Ephraim shakes his head, sad.

dialogues.speaker: EPHRAIM
dialogues.text: No. Ephraim walks away. Avner watches him go.
